episodes.title: Dancer who left '7M TikTok Cult' speaks out : 'You have to show everything is normal; it's not' | Ba
episodes.description:
Dancer Aubrey Fisher, "7M Films" CEO Robert Shinn's former client, joins "Banfield" to share his story of escaping an alleged TikTok dancing cult. Shinn "wanted to make sure that everything you do is posted so that people see that everything is normal. Make it seem like we're not in a cult basically," Fisher said on "Banfield." 

#Netflix #TikTok #Cult

Ashleigh Banfield is *the* definitive authority on the nation’s biggest true crime stories. A veteran award-winning journalist, Ashleigh brings a sharp focus to the crime stories gripping America, distilling facts and analyzing context in a way which captures viewers’ interests and imaginations. No one knows the prosecution and the defendants’ cases better than BANFIELD, all the while keeping the victim at the heart of every story we tell – just another reason NewsNation is truly News for All America.
Weeknights at 10pm/9C. #Banfield

episodes.title: Chad Daybell trial begins Monday with jury selection | Morning in America
episodes.description:
Jury selection will begin Monday in the trial of 55-year-old Chad Daybell, accused of conspiring with his wife, Lori Vallow, to kill his first wife and Vallow’s two children.

#ChadDaybell #LoriVallow #crime

episodes.title: Ruby Franke says she was made to believe in a 'dark delusion' | NewsNation Now
episodes.description:
Convicted child abuser and former family blogger Ruby Franke said she was made to believe in a "dark delusion" by a woman she hired to be a life coach. Advanced regression therapist Lisa Devine joins "NewsNation Now" to discuss Franke's recent comments at her sentencing and how she may still be in a cult-like mentality. 

#RubyFranke #cults #familyblogger

"NewsNation Now" is a no fluff, no filler newscast hosted by Nichole Berlie and Connell McShane featuring up-to-the-minute news drawing from a network of journalists across the U.S. Weekdays starting at 1p/12C.

episodes.title: Cult specialist examines 'Soldiers of Christ' religious group | Banfield
episodes.description:
Five adults and a 15-year-old who call themselves members of the “Soldiers of Christ” religious group are in custody on murder charges after a woman’s body was found in the trunk of a car parked outside a popular spa in Atlanta’s suburbs. Cult intervention specialist Ashlen Hilliard joins "Banfield" to discuss the story.

#Cult #Atlanta 

On "Banfield," big-name celebrities, newsmakers and public figures join Ashleigh for a unique opportunity to sit down and talk. No debates. No shouting over each other. A conversation. Weeknights at 10pm/9C. #Banfield
